column4: I am trying to chown the  /home directory because somehow it got changed and I need to change it back to my username. Anyone have any idea how to do this. Right now I am in live cd and I mounted the drive and tried to do "sudo chown john -R username /home" and it says chown: 'john' : invalid user
its sudo chown <username:group> like chown -R john:users /home/john,you get the idea
the group is not necessary is it
not afaik i've used chowned the way chown --help specifys,it worked:0
if that is not correct, john is the only user on the computer, I haven't really set up groups or multiple accounts, so what would the group be?
i get the same error message, I think it has to do with the fact that I am in live cd
I sudo su before the chown
you need admin in live-cd to change it seems like
I know or think I know there is some keyboard combination that when held allows you to boot into console instead of x, do you know how to do that, it seems like I could change it there
